text: Curaçao Football Federation () is the football association of Curaçao. It is the legal successor of the Netherlands Antillean Football Union, which ended with the dissolution of the Netherlands Antilles in 2010. International matches are represented by the Curaçao national football team. The NAVU was renamed to FFK on 9 February 2011 after FIFA had encouraged changing the name and update statutes, like dealing with Bonaire, who belonged then to the Netherlands. ==History== ==Presidents== ==Trivia== ==See also== ==Notes== ==References== ==External links== * Curaçao Football Federation – official website * Curaçao at FIFA * Curaçao at CONCACAF Category:Football in Curaçao Category:CONCACAF member associations Football Category:Sports organizations established in 1921 Category:1921 establishments in Curaçao and Dependencies
title: Curaçao Football Federation
